CWEs: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Open Redirect and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The Open Redirect vulnerability exists because the function redirects the user to a URL specified in the 'from' query parameter without validating it. An attacker can exploit this to redirect users to a malicious website. The XSS vulnerability exists because the function includes user-supplied data in the response without properly sanitizing it. An attacker can exploit this to inject malicious scripts that will be executed in the user's browser.
